title: Saturn Corporation
summary: The Saturn Corporation, also known as Saturn LLC, was an American automobile manufacturer, a registered trademark established on January 7, 1985, as a subsidiary of General Motors.[1] The company marketed itself as a "different kind of car company" and operated somewhat independently from its parent company for a time with its own assembly plant in Spring Hill, Tennessee,[2] unique models, and a separate retailer network,[3] and was GM's attempt to compete with Japanese imports and transplants in the US compact car market.
